stance_1: Eating out can be challenging
stance_2: Family meals are vegetarian
justification: Family meals being vegetarian may support the challenge of finding vegetarian options when eating out.

stance_1: Eating out can be challenging
stance_2: Friends accommodate my eating habits
justification: The challenge of eating out is lessened when friends accommodate the interviewee's eating habits.

stance_1: Eating vegetarian is cheaper for me
stance_2: I create tasty vegetarian meals at home
justification: Making tasty vegetarian meals at home supports the stance that eating vegetarian is cheaper.

stance_1: Eating vegetarian is cheaper for me
stance_2: I eat vegetarian meals most of the time
justification: Eating vegetarian most of the time likely supports the experience that it is cheaper.

stance_1: Friends accommodate my eating habits
stance_2: I am made fun of for my eating habits
justification: Although friends accommodate the habits, they also poke fun, creating a mild conflict.

stance_1: Friends accommodate my eating habits
stance_2: Most friends were raised eating meat
justification: Despite being raised eating meat, friends still accommodate the interviewee's vegetarian habits.

stance_1: I am conscious about fat intake
stance_2: I avoid red meat and pork
justification: Consciousness about fat intake directly supports avoiding red meat and pork.

stance_1: I am conscious about fat intake
stance_2: I had pancreatitis
justification: Having had pancreatitis led to being conscious about fat intake.

stance_1: I am conscious about fat intake
stance_2: I have health concerns
justification: General health concerns include being conscious about fat intake.

stance_1: I am conscious about fat intake
stance_2: I have high blood pressure
justification: High blood pressure is a health issue that supports being conscious about fat intake.

stance_1: I avoid red meat and pork

justification: Avoiding red meat and pork supports eating vegetarian meals most of the time.

stance_1: I eat vegetarian meals most of the time

justification: Eating vegetarian most of the time is supported by rarely eating chicken or fish.

stance_2: My girlfriend became vegetarian after dating me
justification: The interviewee's vegetarian eating influenced the girlfriend's shift to vegetarianism.

stance_1: I eat vegetarian meals most of the time
stance_2: I was raised vegetarian
justification: Being raised vegetarian supports the habit of eating vegetarian meals most of the time.
